title: Bootstrap: use registry installer helper for skill-installer
description:
Plan expects helper wrapper (docs/plans/2026-01-19-bootstrap-installer-design.md).

Currently skills/project-bootstrap/scripts/bootstrap.py calls install-skill-from-github.py directly and the helper scripts/install_registry_skills.py is unused. Wire bootstrap to use the helper when --install-method=skill-installer and keep TODO/state behavior aligned.
design:
Call scripts/install_registry_skills.py with --json to capture installed/skipped/failed.
Map --force-overwrite-registry-skills to the helper (alias or rename) to keep CLI consistent.
Translate helper output into registry_skills_installed/registry_skills_skipped + TODO entries.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] bootstrap uses scripts/install_registry_skills.py for skill-installer installs
- [ ] existing skill dirs without force are skipped and recorded in registry_skills_skipped + TODO
- [ ] --force-overwrite-registry-skills overwrites existing skills for skill-installer path
- [ ] failures from helper surface as non-zero exit with clear stderr
notes: Use install_registry_skills.py helper for skill-installer path; parse JSON summary into installed/skipped/TODO, map force-overwrite flag, and add helper alias. Tests: uvx pytest -q.
close_reason: Bootstrap uses registry installer helper and records skips/TODOs.
